A 25-year-old man presents with tingling of lips and mouth, nausea, and flushing. He gives a history of eating a Mahi-Mahi fish about an hour back and that it had an unusual taste. He responds well to treatment with intravenous antihistamines. Which of the following is true?

A 58-year-old man on multiple antibiotics is suspected to have pseudomembranous colitis. The criteria for the diagnosis of the suspected condition include all, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Detection of toxin in stool by PCR

options.label: B
options.text: Stool wet mount microscopy to visualize the organism

options.label: C
options.text: ≥3 unformed stools per 24 h for ≥2 days

questions.correct_answer: B. Stool wet mount microscopy to visualize the organism
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Stool wet mount microscopy to visualize the organism

questions.text: A 63-year-old woman has a right-sided ovarian mass found incidentally on transvaginal ultrasound. Surgery is planned to remove the right ovary, including the mass. To avoid excessive bleeding during the oophorectomy, the surgeon should ligate which of the following structures?

A patient presented with a prolonged fever of unknown origin (PUO), raising suspicion of brucellosis. To confirm the diagnosis, various dilutions of the patient's serum sample are prepared for a standard agglutination test. The outcome is as follows: Agglutination is observed at serum dilutions of 1:20 and 1:40, while no agglutination occurs at dilutions of 1:80 and 1:160. What factor is accountable for the lack of agglutination in the last two dilutions?

A 32-year-old man comes to the OPD for a follow-up appointment. The patient recently returned from a 10-day trip to Thailand. On the fifth day of his trip, he developed malaise, anorexia, and abdominal cramps, quickly followed by watery diarrhea. The patient had 5 or 6 stools daily but no fever. The patient felt better after 2 days and has had no additional symptoms since. Which of the following factors was most likely involved in the pathogenesis of this patient's gastrointestinal symptoms?

A young man is rushed to the emergency department after suffering a stab wound over the chest wall. The entry wound is present on the left side in the mid-axillary line. The lung is likely to be injured if the entry wound is above which level?

A 29-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department with new-onset generalized tonic-clonic seizures. She has a history of HIV and has not been taking her medications consistently. According to her family, she has been sleepy and weak for the past 2 weeks. MRI is shown. Which of the following would be effective against the pathogen most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

MRI of 60-year-old female reveals a defect in the territory served by the artery marked in given MRA. Which of the following features is not a component of the syndrome related to the vessel indicated by the yellow arrows?

options.label: A
options.text: Contralateral loss of pain & temperature in trunk and limbs

options.label: B
options.text: Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

options.label: C
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature sensation from face

options.label: D
options.text: Ipsilateral paralysis of muscles of palate

questions.correct_answer: B. Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

questions.text: A 6-hour-old boy is evaluated in the newborn nursery due to temperature instability, grunting, and lethargy. The patient was born at full term to a 21-year-old woman who came to the emergency department in active labor with ruptured membranes; she had not received adequate prenatal care. On physical examination, the boy is hypothermic, tachycardic, and tachypneic, and he has mottled skin. Cultures on blood agar grow bacterial colonies with a narrow zone of clear hemolysis. When these bacteria are grown in the presence of Staphylococcus aureus, the zone of hemolysis is enhanced around the staphylococcal colonies. Which of the following is the most likely pathogen infecting this patient?

A 55-year-old man with a history of smoking and hypertension presents to the clinic with difficulty swallowing and hoarseness. On examination, he has a decreased gag reflex and asymmetry of the soft palate with uvula deviating to the left upon phonation. These findings suggest a lesion in which of the following structures?

A 21-year-old female complains of fever, headache and vomiting from the past 3 days. She has been living in the army recruitment camp for the last three weeks. On examination, she has neck stiffness and petechial rash was noted over the trunk and extremities. Which of the following is false about the disease she's likely suffering from?

options.label: A
options.text: Carriers of this disease can be treated with Rifampicin

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to adrenal hemorrhage

options.label: C
options.text: Terminal complement deficiency increases the risk of this disease

options.label: D
options.text: Azithromycin is the drug of choice

questions.correct_answer: D. Azithromycin is the drug of choice
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Azithromycin is the drug of choice

options.text: It cannot be grown in sabouraud dextrose agar

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. It cannot be grown in sabouraud dextrose agar

questions.text: Match the following –

A 12-year-old boy develops a severe headache, fever, and stiff neck after swimming in a poorly maintained freshwater lake. He rapidly progresses to seizures and altered mental status. CSF examination is shown below. What is the infective form of the organism?

Which of the following is not a branch of the posterior division of the internal iliac artery? Iliolumbar artery Lateral sacral artery Inferior gluteal artery Superior gluteal artery Superior vesical artery Obturator artery

A 17-year-old boy under remission for AML develops severe throat pain. He has lost his ability to swallow and has severe neck and chest pain. Upon admission, he has signs of sepsis and respiratory distress. Which is the organism most likely to be involved in this condition?
In which of the following chambers can one palpate a muscular ridge, which is the site of origin of pectinate muscles?

A 6-month-old boy is evaluated due to cough for 2 weeks. The patient has not received vaccinations. Temperature is 37.1° C (98.8° F), blood pressure is 98/66 mmHg, and respirations are 30/min. Oxygen saturation is 98%. On physical examination, when the patient coughs intermittently, his face turns red. The lungs are clear to auscultation. Leukocyte count is 22,000/mm (75% lymphocytes). The most effective pharmacotherapy for this patient's condition will directly interfere with which of the following cellular processes?
Choose the correct statement regarding CMV?

options.label: A
options.text: Ganciclovir resistance is due to mutation in UL97 phosphotransferase gene

options.label: B
options.text: CMV can be cultured in vitro in any mammalian cell

options.label: C
options.text: Commonest manifestation of CMV associated disease is watery diarrhea

options.label: D
options.text: UL54 mutated CMV strains do not show cross resistance to Foscarnet

questions.correct_answer: A. Ganciclovir resistance is due to mutation in UL97 phosphotransferase gene
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Ganciclovir resistance is due to mutation in UL97 phosphotransferase gene

questions.text: Food poisoning due to which of the following organisms is typically associated with 8-16 hours of incubation period? C. jejuni Bacillus cereus - Emetic type Bacillus cereus - Diarrheal type Vibrio cholerae Clostridium perfringens

options.label: A
options.text: It is the meeting point of frontal, parietal, temporal and maxillary bones.

options.label: B
options.text: Stem of lateral sulcus lies underneath.

options.label: C
options.text: Middle meningeal artery lies under this structure.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. It is the meeting point of frontal, parietal, temporal and maxillary bones.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It is the meeting point of frontal, parietal, temporal and maxillary bones.

questions.text: A man was brought to the hospital after he suffered a stab wound. CT-scan revealed an injury to the part of the artery that lies lateral to pectoralis minor muscle. Which of the following vessels is least likely to have its flow cut off completely?

questions.explanation: Ans. C) No human to human transmission

He returned from a vacation in Kerala 3 weeks ago. His vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal examination shows hyperactive bowel sounds. A photomicrograph of a trichrome-stained wet mount of a stool specimen is shown. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

questions.text: Which among the following statements is true regarding the course of the mandibular nerve? Auriculotemporal nerve is a branch from the anterior division of the mandibular nerve, and it emerges from behind the temporomandibular joint. Buccal branch is a branch from the anterior division of the mandibular nerve, and it emerges from behind the mandibular ramus. Lingual nerve is a branch from the posterior division of the mandibular nerve, and it arcs around the submandibular duct. Ophthalmic nerve is a branch from the anterior division of the mandibular nerve, and it arises in the middle cranial fossa.
